poem:
### Feather and Fever

In the still morning,  
beneath a sky painted  
with invisible tints of disease,  
the untested heart  
wonders at the slow spread.  
No feathers fall, only shadows  
of wings touching the earth.  
The silent migration  
through the unknowing,  
a riddle of blood and breath,  
as we wait, unmeasured,  
in the presence of fear.
